parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To build upon (above) a foundation. From epi and oikodomeo; to build upon, i.e. to rear up.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a derivative of tithemi; something put down, i.e. A substruction.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
In the corner (of a building); subst: corner-(stone). From akron and gonia; belonging to the extreme corner.
